result.execSummary:
The defendant Sadie Marie Milligan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sadie Marie Milligan is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Sadie Marie Milligan was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct w/motor vehicle. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sadie Marie Milligan

records.addlTxt: 10:32 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sadie Marie Milligan not in court.  Attorney Robert A Kennedy Jr. in court for Sadie Marie Milligan. 21CM46 and 22CM16. Seifert - was set for motion hearing but believes there is now a resolution. Kennedy had global settlement on both matters, one ordinance and 22CM16 would have plead to as alleged, unsure of where she is, notes she has had some medical issues. Court based on non-appearance, issues bench warrant, body or $500 in each case. Back on the record, 10:38 AM. Defendant now appears in person. Court questions if the state has complied with victim witness notification. State has complied with both victims in 21CM46. Kennedy recites agreement 21CM46 - both counts will plead to both charges as alleged, joint recommendation, count 1 fine of $500 plus costs. Count 2 - court costs only. On 22CM16 - count 1 amend to FC Ordinance of  disorderly conduct with a motor vehicle, with a fine of $300 plus costs. Count 2 would be dismissed. 22CM16 court dismiss count 2. Amends count one to FC Ordinance of DC with MV. Milligan pleads NC to the amended charge. Court accepts plea and adjudges guilty, fine of $300 plus costs, 60 DTP/CO. In 21CM46, Milligan pleads NC to both counts. Court has PLQ, goes over the form with defendant, finds she is freely, voluntarily and intelligently entering her plea, waiving her constitutional rights and right to trial, finds factual basis exists, accepts plea of NC and adjudges guilty of counts 1 & 2 as alleged. State make statement and asks court to follow joint recommendation. Kennedy make statement and asks court to follow recommendation. Milligan with holds comment. Court has considered all statements, gravity of offence, considered all factors, will accept joint recommendation and on count one imposes fine of $500 plus court costs. On count 2 - court costs only, 60 DTP/CO. DNA sample with surcharge. Appeal rights given.

09:03 AM Defendant Sadie Marie Milligan in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Kennedy and Milligan have complaint, waives reading of it, enters NG plea. Court addresses bond, Clerk informs Court that the bond form was returned with a No Mail Receptacle, verifies address. Milligan states that we have the correct address. Court warns that defendant could be arrested for not following Court's order. Clerk reprints bond and defendant sign it. Court continues bond, accepts plea, set for JT.
Unsigned Bail Bonds - NMR (Resent to 3556 County Hwy H, Laona, WI)
Adjourned initial appearance on April 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Must sign and return within 10 days.

09:28 AM Defendant Sadie Marie Milligan appears by video.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Milligan has not received a copy of the complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Milligan understands. Court questions if she has contacted an attorney. Milligan has not, asks for time to retain an attorney. Court advises of right to an attorney and the options of obtaining an attorney, SPD, private hire and court appointed attorney if not eligible. Milligan understands. State asks for $250 signature bond. Court imposes $250 signature bond and must sign and return within 10 days. Milligan understands. Court has AIA scheduled for 4/20/22 at 9:00 AM.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:10 AM Defendant Sadie Marie Milligan not in court.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin appears by video. CC and CR appear by video. State - Milligan is unavailable, medical issue and will re-summons Milligan for a new court date. Court will allow and have state resummons.
